00033  * currently there are some cases we don't support.
00034  * - passing output paths to the visitor?, like render out.
00035  * - passing sequence strips with many images.
00036  * - passing directory paths - visitors don't know which path is a dir or a file.
00037  * */

00083 static int checkMissingFiles_visit_cb(void *userdata, char *UNUSED(path_dst), const char *path_src)
00084 {
00085     ReportList *reports = (ReportList *)userdata;
00086 
00087     if (!BLI_exists(path_src)) {
00088         BKE_reportf(reports, RPT_WARNING, "Path Not Found \"%s\"", path_src);
00089     }
00090 
00091     return FALSE;
00092 }
00093 
00094 /* high level function */
00095 void checkMissingFiles(Main *bmain, ReportList *reports)
00096 {
00097     bpath_traverse_main(bmain, checkMissingFiles_visit_cb, BPATH_TRAVERSE_ABS, reports);
00098 }

00100 typedef struct BPathRemap_Data {
00101     const char *basedir;
00102     ReportList *reports;
00103 
00104     int count_tot;
00105     int count_changed;
00106     int count_failed;
00107 } BPathRemap_Data;
00108 
00109 static int makeFilesRelative_visit_cb(void *userdata, char *path_dst, const char *path_src)
00110 {
00111     BPathRemap_Data *data = (BPathRemap_Data *)userdata;
00112 
00113     data->count_tot++;
00114 
00115     if (strncmp(path_src, "//", 2) == 0) {
00116         return FALSE; /* already relative */
00117     }
00118     else {
00119         strcpy(path_dst, path_src);
00120         BLI_path_rel(path_dst, data->basedir);
00121         if (strncmp(path_dst, "//", 2) == 0) {
00122             data->count_changed++;
00123         }
00124         else {
00125             BKE_reportf(data->reports, RPT_WARNING, "Path cant be made relative \"%s\"", path_src);
00126             data->count_failed++;
00127         }
00128         return TRUE;
00129     }
00130 }
00131 
00132 void makeFilesRelative(Main *bmain, const char *basedir, ReportList *reports)
00133 {
00134     BPathRemap_Data data = {NULL};
00135 
00136     if (basedir[0] == '\0') {
00137         printf("%s: basedir='', this is a bug\n", __func__);
00138         return;
00139     }
00140 
00141     data.basedir = basedir;
00142     data.reports = reports;
00143 
00144     bpath_traverse_main(bmain, makeFilesRelative_visit_cb, 0, (void *)&data);
00145 
00146     BKE_reportf(reports, data.count_failed ? RPT_WARNING : RPT_INFO,
00147                 "Total files %d|Changed %d|Failed %d",
00148                 data.count_tot, data.count_changed, data.count_failed);
00149 }
00150 
00151 static int makeFilesAbsolute_visit_cb(void *userdata, char *path_dst, const char *path_src)
00152 {
00153     BPathRemap_Data *data = (BPathRemap_Data *)userdata;
00154 
00155     data->count_tot++;
00156 
00157     if (strncmp(path_src, "//", 2) != 0) {
00158         return FALSE; /* already absolute */
00159     }
00160     else {
00161         strcpy(path_dst, path_src);
00162         BLI_path_abs(path_dst, data->basedir);
00163         if (strncmp(path_dst, "//", 2) != 0) {
00164             data->count_changed++;
00165         }
00166         else {
00167             BKE_reportf(data->reports, RPT_WARNING, "Path cant be made absolute \"%s\"", path_src);
00168             data->count_failed++;
00169         }
00170         return TRUE;
00171     }
00172 }
00173 
00174 /* similar to makeFilesRelative - keep in sync! */
00175 void makeFilesAbsolute(Main *bmain, const char *basedir, ReportList *reports)
00176 {
00177     BPathRemap_Data data = {NULL};
00178 
00179     if (basedir[0] == '\0') {
00180         printf("%s: basedir='', this is a bug\n", __func__);
00181         return;
00182     }
00183 
00184     data.basedir = basedir;
00185     data.reports = reports;
00186 
00187     bpath_traverse_main(bmain, makeFilesAbsolute_visit_cb, 0, (void *)&data);
00188 
00189     BKE_reportf(reports, data.count_failed ? RPT_WARNING : RPT_INFO,
00190                 "Total files %d|Changed %d|Failed %d",
00191                 data.count_tot, data.count_changed, data.count_failed);
00192 }

00194 /* find this file recursively, use the biggest file so thumbnails don't get used by mistake
00195  * - dir: subdir to search
00196  * - filename: set this filename
00197  * - filesize: filesize for the file
00198  *
00199  * return found: 1/0.
00200  */
00201 #define MAX_RECUR 16
00202 static int findFileRecursive(char *filename_new,
00203                              const char *dirname,
00204                              const char *filename,
00205                              int *filesize,
00206                              int *recur_depth)
00207 {
00208     /* file searching stuff */
00209     DIR *dir;
00210     struct dirent *de;
00211     struct stat status;
00212     char path[FILE_MAX];
00213     int size;
00214     int found = FALSE;
00215 
00216     filename_new[0] = '\0';
00217 
00218     dir = opendir(dirname);
00219 
00220     if (dir == NULL)
00221         return found;
00222 
00223     if (*filesize == -1)
00224         *filesize = 0; /* dir opened fine */
00225 
00226     while ((de = readdir(dir)) != NULL) {
00227 
00228         if (strcmp(".", de->d_name) == 0 || strcmp("..", de->d_name) == 0)
00229             continue;
00230 
00231         BLI_join_dirfile(path, sizeof(path), dirname, de->d_name);
00232 
00233         if (stat(path, &status) != 0)
00234             continue; /* cant stat, don't bother with this file, could print debug info here */
00235 
00236         if (S_ISREG(status.st_mode)) { /* is file */
00237             if (strncmp(filename, de->d_name, FILE_MAX) == 0) { /* name matches */
00238                 /* open the file to read its size */
00239                 size = status.st_size;
00240                 if ((size > 0) && (size > *filesize)) { /* find the biggest file */
00241                     *filesize = size;
00242                     BLI_strncpy(filename_new, path, FILE_MAX);
00243                     found = TRUE;
00244                 }
00245             }
00246         }
00247         else if (S_ISDIR(status.st_mode)) { /* is subdir */
00248             if (*recur_depth <= MAX_RECUR) {
00249                 (*recur_depth)++;
00250                 found |= findFileRecursive(filename_new, path, filename, filesize, recur_depth);
00251                 (*recur_depth)--;
00252             }
00253         }
00254     }
00255     closedir(dir);
00256     return found;
00257 }
00258 
00259 typedef struct BPathFind_Data {
00260     const char *basedir;
00261     char searchdir[FILE_MAX];
00262     ReportList *reports;
00263 } BPathFind_Data;
00264 
00265 static int findMissingFiles_visit_cb(void *userdata, char *path_dst, const char *path_src)
00266 {
00267     BPathFind_Data *data = (BPathFind_Data *)userdata;
00268     char filename_new[FILE_MAX];
00269 
00270     int filesize = -1;
00271     int recur_depth = 0;
00272     int found;
00273 
00274     found = findFileRecursive(filename_new,
00275                               data->searchdir, BLI_path_basename((char *)path_src),
00276                               &filesize, &recur_depth);
00277 
00278     if (filesize == -1) { /* could not open dir */
00279         BKE_reportf(data->reports, RPT_WARNING,
00280                     "Could open directory \"%s\"",
00281                     BLI_path_basename(data->searchdir));
00282         return FALSE;
00283     }
00284     else if (found == FALSE) {
00285         BKE_reportf(data->reports, RPT_WARNING,
00286                     "Could not find \"%s\" in \"%s\"",
00287                     BLI_path_basename((char *)path_src), data->searchdir);
00288         return FALSE;
00289     }
00290     else {
00291         BLI_strncpy(path_dst, filename_new, FILE_MAX);
00292         return TRUE;
00293     }
00294 }
00295 
00296 void findMissingFiles(Main *bmain, const char *searchpath, ReportList *reports)
00297 {
00298     struct BPathFind_Data data = {NULL};
00299 
00300     data.reports = reports;
00301     BLI_split_dir_part(searchpath, data.searchdir, sizeof(data.searchdir));
00302 
00303     bpath_traverse_main(bmain, findMissingFiles_visit_cb, 0, (void *)&data);
00304 }
00305 
00306 /* Run a visitor on a string, replacing the contents of the string as needed. */
00307 static int rewrite_path_fixed(char *path, BPathVisitor visit_cb, const char *absbase, void *userdata)
00308 {
00309     char path_src_buf[FILE_MAX];
00310     const char *path_src;
00311     char path_dst[FILE_MAX];
00312 
00313     if (absbase) {
00314         BLI_strncpy(path_src_buf, path, sizeof(path_src_buf));
00315         BLI_path_abs(path_src_buf, absbase);
00316         path_src = path_src_buf;
00317     }
00318     else {
00319         path_src = path;
00320     }
00321 
00322     if (visit_cb(userdata, path_dst, path_src)) {
00323         BLI_strncpy(path, path_dst, FILE_MAX);
00324         return TRUE;
00325     }
00326     else {
00327         return FALSE;
00328     }
00329 }
00330 
00331 static int rewrite_path_fixed_dirfile(char path_dir[FILE_MAXDIR],
00332                                       char path_file[FILE_MAXFILE],
00333                                       BPathVisitor visit_cb,
00334                                       const char *absbase,
00335                                       void *userdata)
00336 {
00337     char path_src[FILE_MAX];
00338     char path_dst[FILE_MAX];
00339 
00340     BLI_join_dirfile(path_src, sizeof(path_src), path_dir, path_file);
00341 
00342     if (absbase) {
00343         BLI_path_abs(path_src, absbase);
00344     }
00345 
00346     if (visit_cb(userdata, path_dst, (const char *)path_src)) {
00347         BLI_split_dirfile(path_dst, path_dir, path_file, FILE_MAXDIR, FILE_MAXFILE);
00348         return TRUE;
00349     }
00350     else {
00351         return FALSE;
00352     }
00353 }
00354 
00355 static int rewrite_path_alloc(char **path, BPathVisitor visit_cb, const char *absbase, void *userdata)
00356 {
00357     char path_src_buf[FILE_MAX];
00358     const char *path_src;
00359     char path_dst[FILE_MAX];
00360 
00361     if (absbase) {
00362         BLI_strncpy(path_src_buf, *path, sizeof(path_src_buf));
00363         BLI_path_abs(path_src_buf, absbase);
00364         path_src = path_src_buf;
00365     }
00366     else {
00367         path_src = *path;
00368     }
00369 
00370     if (visit_cb(userdata, path_dst, path_src)) {
00371         MEM_freeN((*path));
00372         (*path) = BLI_strdup(path_dst);
00373         return TRUE;
00374     }
00375     else {
00376         return FALSE;
00377     }
00378 }
00379 
00380 /* Run visitor function 'visit' on all paths contained in 'id'. */
00381 void bpath_traverse_id(Main *bmain, ID *id, BPathVisitor visit_cb, const int flag, void *bpath_user_data)
00382 {
00383     Image *ima;
00384     const char *absbase = (flag & BPATH_TRAVERSE_ABS) ? ID_BLEND_PATH(bmain, id) : NULL;
00385 
00386     if ((flag & BPATH_TRAVERSE_SKIP_LIBRARY) && id->lib) {
00387         return;
00388     }
00389 
00390     switch(GS(id->name)) {
00391     case ID_IM:
00392         ima= (Image *)id;
00393         if (ima->packedfile == NULL || (flag & BPATH_TRAVERSE_SKIP_PACKED) == 0) {
00394             if (ELEM3(ima->source, IMA_SRC_FILE, IMA_SRC_MOVIE, IMA_SRC_SEQUENCE)) {
00395                 rewrite_path_fixed(ima->name, visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00396             }
00397         }
00398         break;
00399     case ID_BR:
00400         {
00401             Brush *brush= (Brush *)id;
00402             if (brush->icon_filepath[0]) {
00403                 rewrite_path_fixed(brush->icon_filepath, visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00404             }
00405         }
00406         break;
00407     case ID_OB:
00408 
00409 #define BPATH_TRAVERSE_POINTCACHE(ptcaches)                                    \
00410     {                                                                          \
00411         PointCache *cache;                                                     \
00412         for (cache= (ptcaches).first; cache; cache= cache->next) {              \
00413             if (cache->flag & PTCACHE_DISK_CACHE) {                             \
00414                 rewrite_path_fixed(cache->path,                                \
00415                                    visit_cb,                                   \
00416                                    absbase,                                    \
00417                                    bpath_user_data);                           \
00418             }                                                                  \
00419         }                                                                      \
00420     }                                                                          \
00421 
00422 
00423         {
00424             Object *ob= (Object *)id;
00425             ModifierData *md;
00426             ParticleSystem *psys;
00427 
00428             /* do via modifiers instead */
00429 #if 0
00430             if (ob->fluidsimSettings) {
00431                 rewrite_path_fixed(ob->fluidsimSettings->surfdataPath, visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00432             }
00433 #endif
00434 
00435             for (md= ob->modifiers.first; md; md= md->next) {
00436                 if (md->type == eModifierType_Fluidsim) {
00437                     FluidsimModifierData *fluidmd= (FluidsimModifierData *)md;
00438                     if (fluidmd->fss) {
00439                         rewrite_path_fixed(fluidmd->fss->surfdataPath, visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00440                     }
00441                 }
00442                 else if (md->type == eModifierType_Smoke) {
00443                     SmokeModifierData *smd= (SmokeModifierData *)md;
00444                     if (smd->type & MOD_SMOKE_TYPE_DOMAIN) {
00445                         BPATH_TRAVERSE_POINTCACHE(smd->domain->ptcaches[0]);
00446                     }
00447                 }
00448                 else if (md->type==eModifierType_Cloth) {
00449                     ClothModifierData *clmd= (ClothModifierData*) md;
00450                     BPATH_TRAVERSE_POINTCACHE(clmd->ptcaches);
00451                 }
00452                 else if (md->type==eModifierType_Ocean) {
00453                     OceanModifierData *omd= (OceanModifierData*) md;
00454                     rewrite_path_fixed(omd->cachepath, visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00455                 }
00456             }
00457 
00458             if (ob->soft) {
00459                 BPATH_TRAVERSE_POINTCACHE(ob->soft->ptcaches);
00460             }
00461 
00462             for (psys= ob->particlesystem.first; psys; psys= psys->next) {
00463                 BPATH_TRAVERSE_POINTCACHE(psys->ptcaches);
00464             }
00465         }
00466 
00467 #undef BPATH_TRAVERSE_POINTCACHE
00468 
00469         break;
00470     case ID_SO:
00471         {
00472             bSound *sound= (bSound *)id;
00473             if (sound->packedfile == NULL || (flag & BPATH_TRAVERSE_SKIP_PACKED) == 0) {
00474                 rewrite_path_fixed(sound->name, visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00475             }
00476         }
00477         break;
00478     case ID_TXT:
00479         if (((Text*)id)->name) {
00480             rewrite_path_alloc(&((Text *)id)->name, visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00481         }
00482         break;
00483     case ID_VF:
00484         {
00485             VFont *vf= (VFont *)id;
00486             if (vf->packedfile == NULL || (flag & BPATH_TRAVERSE_SKIP_PACKED) == 0) {
00487                 if (strcmp(vf->name, FO_BUILTIN_NAME) != 0) {
00488                     rewrite_path_fixed(((VFont *)id)->name, visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00489                 }
00490             }
00491         }
00492         break;
00493     case ID_TE:
00494         {
00495             Tex *tex = (Tex *)id;
00496             if (tex->plugin) {
00497                 /* FIXME: rewrite_path assumes path length of FILE_MAX, but
00498                  * tex->plugin->name is 160. ... is this field even a path? */
00499                 //rewrite_path(tex->plugin->name, visit_cb, bpath_user_data);
00500             }
00501             if (tex->type == TEX_VOXELDATA && TEX_VD_IS_SOURCE_PATH(tex->vd->file_format)) {
00502                 rewrite_path_fixed(tex->vd->source_path, visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00503             }
00504         }
00505         break;
00506 
00507     case ID_SCE:
00508         {
00509             Scene *scene= (Scene *)id;
00510             if (scene->ed) {
00511                 Sequence *seq;
00512 
00513                 SEQ_BEGIN(scene->ed, seq) {
00514                     if (SEQ_HAS_PATH(seq)) {
00515                         if (ELEM(seq->type, SEQ_MOVIE, SEQ_SOUND)) {
00516                             rewrite_path_fixed_dirfile(seq->strip->dir, seq->strip->stripdata->name,
00517                                                        visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00518                         }
00519                         else if (seq->type == SEQ_IMAGE) {
00520                             /* might want an option not to loop over all strips */
00521                             StripElem *se= seq->strip->stripdata;
00522                             int len= MEM_allocN_len(se) / sizeof(*se);
00523                             int i;
00524 
00525                             if (flag & BPATH_TRAVERSE_SKIP_MULTIFILE) {
00526                                 /* only operate on one path */
00527                                 len= MIN2(1, len);
00528                             }
00529 
00530                             for (i= 0; i < len; i++, se++) {
00531                                 rewrite_path_fixed_dirfile(seq->strip->dir, se->name,
00532                                                            visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00533                             }
00534                         }
00535                         else {
00536                             /* simple case */
00537                             rewrite_path_fixed(seq->strip->dir, visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00538                         }
00539                     }
00540                     else if (seq->plugin) {
00541                         rewrite_path_fixed(seq->plugin->name, visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00542                     }
00543 
00544                 }
00545                 SEQ_END
00546             }
00547         }
00548         break;
00549     case ID_ME:
00550         {
00551             Mesh *me= (Mesh *)id;
00552             if (me->fdata.external) {
00553                 rewrite_path_fixed(me->fdata.external->filename, visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00554             }
00555         }
00556         break;
00557     case ID_LI:
00558         {
00559             Library *lib= (Library *)id;
00560             if (rewrite_path_fixed(lib->name, visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data)) {
00561                 BKE_library_filepath_set(lib, lib->name);
00562             }
00563         }
00564         break;
00565     case ID_MC:
00566         {
00567             MovieClip *clip= (MovieClip *)id;
00568             rewrite_path_fixed(clip->name, visit_cb, absbase, bpath_user_data);
00569         }
00570         break;
00571     default:
00572         /* Nothing to do for other IDs that don't contain file paths. */
00573         break;
00574     }
00575 }
00576 
00577 void bpath_traverse_id_list(Main *bmain, ListBase *lb, BPathVisitor visit_cb, const int flag, void *bpath_user_data)
00578 {
00579     ID *id;
00580     for (id = lb->first; id; id = id->next) {
00581         bpath_traverse_id(bmain, id, visit_cb, flag, bpath_user_data);
00582     }
00583 }
00584 
00585 void bpath_traverse_main(Main *bmain, BPathVisitor visit_cb, const int flag, void *bpath_user_data)
00586 {
00587     ListBase *lbarray[MAX_LIBARRAY];
00588     int a = set_listbasepointers(bmain, lbarray);
00589     while (a--) {
00590         bpath_traverse_id_list(bmain, lbarray[a], visit_cb, flag, bpath_user_data);
00591     }
00592 }
00593 
00594 /* Rewrites a relative path to be relative to the main file - unless the path is
00595  * absolute, in which case it is not altered. */
00596 int bpath_relocate_visitor(void *pathbase_v, char *path_dst, const char *path_src)
00597 {
00598     /* be sure there is low chance of the path being too short */
00599     char filepath[(FILE_MAXDIR * 2) + FILE_MAXFILE];
00600     const char *base_new = ((char **)pathbase_v)[0];
00601     const char *base_old = ((char **)pathbase_v)[1];
00602 
00603     if (strncmp(base_old, "//", 2) == 0) {
00604         printf("%s: error, old base path '%s' is not absolute.\n",
00605                __func__, base_old);
00606         return FALSE;
00607     }
00608 
00609     /* Make referenced file absolute. This would be a side-effect of
00610      * BLI_cleanup_file, but we do it explicitly so we know if it changed. */
00611     BLI_strncpy(filepath, path_src, FILE_MAX);
00612     if (BLI_path_abs(filepath, base_old)) {
00613         /* Path was relative and is now absolute. Remap.
00614          * Important BLI_cleanup_dir runs before the path is made relative
00615          * because it wont work for paths that start with "//../" */
00616         BLI_cleanup_file(base_new, filepath);
00617         BLI_path_rel(filepath, base_new);
00618         BLI_strncpy(path_dst, filepath, FILE_MAX);
00619         return TRUE;
00620     }
00621     else {
00622         /* Path was not relative to begin with. */
00623         return FALSE;
00624     }
00625 }
